topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d9b09a63687243ca270000#post_53d9b09a63687243ca270000
They'd figure out a Way.

I might as well go over them.

The Double riders

#1 is the rider of Technique, #2 is the rider of Power, Combined, They're a force of Nature

V3

A rider with the Technique of the first and the Power of the Second, He also has 23 different techniques up his sleeves.

Riderman

Easily the weakest of the 7, Only having a prosthetic arm rather than full on modification, But He easily makes up for that with Cunning, Able to use Different Arm attachments to suit the situation

X Rider

More powerful than any of the previous riders. His Ridol can become a whip, a staff and a rope, He's at his best in the water, And he can survive 10,000 meters below sea level.

Amazon rider

Amazon is a Magically enhanced rider, He can heal rapidly, He prefers clawing and Biting his opponents, He can lace his claws with venom, And His Super Daisetsudan is powerful enough to chop a T Rex clean in half

Stronger

Easily the most powerful of the 7, Every attack is laced with powerful electric shocks, And he has a Super mode where he's even more powerful (But he has to use it all, Or else he'll explode)
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@Ore-O":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d9b25763687243cabd0000#post_53d9b25763687243cabd0000
Call me a pessimist, but this may very well be gg Africa because the entire region has been a proverbial powder keg waiting to go off disease wise.  A lot of the countries simply theoretically could not handle a outbreak if it were to happen.  If it crosses the Sahara bye bye Africa.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d9b2836368724ee59a0100#post_53d9b2836368724ee59a0100

They might. Trapping the souls works. They'd have to find a way to kill the soul to do anything permanent.

Here's the Judges "specs"

Death: He can phase his hand into bodies and crush organs, ussually the heart. Technically immortal.

Mortis: He touches you, you rot to death. It ain't pretty. Technically immortal.

Fear: Opens up that helmet and you see your worst fear, you die. Technically immortal.

Fire: Exactly what it says on the badge. Technically immortal.


...I am such a nerd.

topics.body:
I have a question; I'm designing the main character for the video game I want to make and I'm trying to avoid the current depiction of vampires as much as possible, aka the sparkly vampires.  The main character is a vampire, but even though she is five hundred years old she's a full blown adult with a job and even though her wife is a human their relationship isn't emotionally abusive like twilight and part of the story revolves around them working together as a team to help make sure their kid is safe.  The type of warrior she is a knight.  So basically imagine Saber from fate/stay as a vampire but instead of defending her partner part of the story is about them working together as equals.  Also she's regal and while she's from the middle ages she doesn't go around going, "doth/thou" or such, but her battle style is more along the lines of a knight in modern era.

That doesn't sound anything like Twilight does it?

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d9b9a86368727e99c80000#post_53d9b9a86368727e99c80000
I was just kind of worried, cause thanks to Twilight the vampire genre has been fucking butchered to hell.

If you're wondering what sort of armor I'm giving her it's functional medieval armor.

So something like this:
!http://31.media.tumblr.com/660ad76e4a96010ede0d80df7534692c/tumblr_myppax0KKk1rdy3s5o1_r4_250.jpg!
But with a bit more flair combined with tournament armor for a bit more color that is still functional; so like a surcoat and a cloak on top of it.  I'm going to do a bit of bullshit though and instead of a visor have reinforced glass instead so her face can be seen.
